title: image-set()
description: The `image-set()` CSS function defines a list of images to be used in an element, allowing for different image sources to be selected based on factors, such as resolution or display capabilities.
content: The function that allows defining multiple versions of an image for different screen resolutions. It's similar to the `srcset` attribute in HTML and helps to deliver the best quality image based on the user's device, improving visual performance.
